meaningMnemonic:
This <kanji>Shinto shrine</kanji> you're visiting? Turns out if you go inside it's magically turned into the <vocabulary>imperial palace</vocabulary>. Wow! Feels like I’m a member of the <vocabulary>imperial family</vocabulary> now.

宮 is a historical word that generally refers to Japanese imperial palaces, the Japanese imperial family, or the imperial family members. Depending on the context, it can also refer to a Shinto shrine or its buildings.
readingMnemonic: The reading is the same as the kanji reading you learned.
